wikipedia_page.main: Ernest Claude Meysey-Thompson (18 February 1859 – 28 February 1944) was a British Army officer and Liberal Unionist Party (later Conservative Party) politician. He sat in the House of Commons from 1906 to 1922 as the Member of Parliament (MP) for Handsworth.

List of Liberal Unionist Party MPs

response: The six K5 divisions were to be numbered 37th to 42nd,Becke, Pt 3b, Appendix 2. and the 38th Division was formed from Pals battalions raised in the North of England such as the Accrington Pals,Jackson. the Sheffield City Battalion, and a whole brigade of Hull Pals.Bilton. The first artillery unit assigned to the division was the CLV (West Yorkshire) Brigade (155th Bde) of the Royal Field Artillery (RFA), raised by the Leeds-based West Yorkshire Coal Owners' Association for which authority was given by the War Office (WO) on 1 February 1915.War Office Instructions July 1915, Appendix VI. Shortly afterwards the other RFA brigades for this division were raised from Yorkshire towns by Major Ernest Meysey-Thompson, MP:Becke, Pt 3b, pp. 11–19.War Office Instructions September 1915, Appendix VII.
